page.title: 17HOUSING IN DALBEATTIE
page.content: Before granite was discovered locally the houses in Dalbeattie were made from stone and brick.There is one of these houses in the High Street with the date shown on the wall.It says, "Hugh McGeorge built this in 1781". When granite was discovered it was used for terraced houses in many of the streets.In time granite became too expensive for this.Council housing schemes were built of cheaper material like brick, with a roughcast finish, four homes to a block and two storeys high.Many of these houses are now being bought by the tenants from the Stewartry District Council. Private housing developments sprang up in more recent years on the outskirts of the town with detached and semi-detached houses,some bungalows and some of two storeys.
